div.div: ἀλλότριος : of or belonging to another, strange; γαῖα, ἀλλότρια, ‘others' goods’; ἀλλότριος φῶς, ‘foe - man’; γναθμοῖσι γελώων ἀλλοτρίοισιν, were laughing ‘with jaws as of other men’ (distorted faces), description of supernatural effects, Od. 20.347, cf. 351 ff.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
